website_summaries.verdict: An adorable choice for those looking for a larger, barn-inspired dog house for their pup.
pros: Weight capacity can handle up to 100 pounds
Built-in vents for interior air circulation
cons: Flimsier than a few customers expected

website_summaries.verdict: This exceedingly popular dog house showcases an extra-large design with supremely adorable features.
pros: Can hold dogs up to 100 pounds
Comes with letters for name personalization on front doors
Built-in vents allow air circulation throughout house
cons: Plastic could be thicker and sturdier
Roof can be difficult to assemble

customer_reviews.title: Great House for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: So far, this dog house is wonderful! Super easy to put together (I did it by myself). Seems to be pretty resilient to weather, even to some flooding and high winds. I am not using this in its conventional way, this is actually a house for my two Pekin Ducks.
customer_reviews.author: Chicklette

customer_reviews.title: Not for dogs that like to chew.
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery and easy to put together but not for dogs that like to chew. Only a week old and our dog has definitely left her mark on it. Still can't complain though. The dog house is everything the ad said it was.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: It assembles easily, but Enso disassembles it easily too LOL
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if one star is justified, but that's what I'm giving. The price is very low, you pay for what you get. I bought the big dog house because it's for a 65 pound dog. Enso has had it for two months and it's completely torn apart. It's very thin plastic and not strong at all. It assembles easily, but Enso disassembles it easily too LOL. We also have a much more expensive Igloo for our other dog and although expensive, it's very, very tough... probably worth the expense for certain dogs like ours.
customer_reviews.author: E. Block

customer_reviews.title: This served as a good dog house time and time again with every resurrection
customer_reviews.text: This served as a good dog house time and time again with every resurrection. We have a very proud, destructive pup of 1 and a half years of age who made it his mission to gnaw, paw and utterly tear apart this house. First it was the roof corners, then the front door opening, moving on to the sides. I rebound and re-zip tied until finally it was unrecognizable and unrepairable. So we put it out to pasture and replaced it with something even he can't destroy. I said all that to say this...If your dog doesn't have a destructive streak, this is a great little house.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah J.

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed in Suncast
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after having many Suncast products, including their outdoor garden shed & furniture. When I opened the box I immediately knew that I needed to return the product as the walls were so thin that the structure would not hold up to use. The plastic is only 1/6" as compared to the 1/4" on a Igloo. Sorry SunCast, but you failed me this time!
customer_reviews.author: James L Busch

customer_reviews.title: Nice dollhouse, not a dog house
customer_reviews.text: This alleged "dog house": -Made of flimsy inferior materials. -Does not stay together once assembled if your dogs move around in it at all. -Requires repeated reassembly due to above - Would make a great doll house for your kids NOT A GOOD PURCHASE FOR LIVING DOGS, maybe stuffed ones
customer_reviews.author: James Shupe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome home excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I rescued 2 huskies, Winter & Snow, unexpectedly and I needed 2 dog homes asap. I am so glad I got this home for them. It arrived quickly in excellent condition. It took minutes to assemble. It is durable, easy to move around, light weight, and beautiful. It was an affordable solution and we love it! I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Lani G

customer_reviews.title: it is a great house. it is light and easy to move
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned when we opened it, as it appeared it may not be strong enough. I was mistaken. it is a great house. it is light and easy to move. We get some standing water at times in heavy rain, so I used the points made to stake it down if desired, and mounted ours to a pallet. Keeps it a few inches off the ground and easy to move. For the price, you will not find a better house. I have a large lab/pit mix (a whopping 170 lb monster of a dog) and she bolts in and out of it with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L Jones

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dogs, flawed for cats. But again, this is a DOG house.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the kitty colony in my neighborhood to shield them from rain & provide overall shelter. If you're using this house for cats, it really needs a second escape door otherwise they dont use it as much. My next step is to find something strong to cut through the tough plastic and create a second door. Other than that, its a VERY sturdy, strong, leak free home for your pets. Inexpensive & easy to assemble. More lik 4.5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jovana J

customer_reviews.title: This house has worked beautifully for my pit-lab mix
customer_reviews.text: This house has worked beautifully for my pit-lab mix. It is plenty big - even accommodates me (barely) when I put up some solar fairy lights on the ceiling. It was fairly easy to set up by myself. Once completely together, VERY sturdy. Has kept my dog warm/dry through some fairly decent so-cal rainstorms. I initially put on the little flaps (which would have kept her more dry/warm) but she didn't like them. They kinda catch at the bottom so it is more difficult to enter/exit than a doggie door. Additionally, if you put bedding inside, the flaps get caught on them...
customer_reviews.author: Blair Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money, but if your dog is active, it may not hold up
customer_reviews.text: The heavy duty clear plastic "doors" are great in theory, but they attach to pegs on the inside, and when I put this together the pegs were already broken off so no doors for Fido. It is cute, not garish. The floor is in two pieces with a seam in the middle, so this winter when I raise it off the ground I will have to come up with something to shore it up. Good for the money, but I don't know if I'd get it again. The construction is easy, but light duty. My 10 year old beagle is fine, but a younger dog who moves faster may be too much.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Waidley

customer_reviews.title: Good house for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent sized dog house. My 1 year old played in it while we were putting it together. All the pieces just snap together. It doesn’t take that long to put together. We didn’t leave the plastic flaps in it, because our dog won’t go inside the house with them on it. It’s outside on our porch so it’s somewhat covered from the elements. It’s study and does well in the rain. It doesn’t leak. We have a 40 pound, 7 month old Lab/Shepherd mix. The dog and my three year old son fit comfortably inside this house.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Little

customer_reviews.title: Good for now
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly -consider it more of a medium size dog house my Rottweiler fits okay--daughter put together so it must be easy to assemble
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: I'd already read the reviews and didn't expect anything super stellar, or sturdy. It was late to arrive, and I didn't really get a reason as to why. Once I actually received the product the box was pretty beat up, which worried me. But upon opening it the pieces weren't broken. It's easy to assemble, you just snap on all parts of the house. It's like a child's play house. It's obviously not the toughest, and the plastic is flimsy. But it's just as pictured, so no surprises there. It's cute though, and it's a good big size.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Not water/weatherproof
customer_reviews.text: While I was happy with the product initially--particularly its size, it is much flimsier than I expected and does leak quite a bit. I've tried to find and seal all of the leaks, but it seems this kind of house was not meant to be used in an environment as wet/rainy as ours. This product might be useful for those with additional coverage--awnings, use inside a garage, etc. I will continue with my search for a good outdoor pet house.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Really cheap plastic. Will not hold up to a breeze. Extremely difficult to assemble outside with a 5 MPH breeze. Had to assemble outside due to its size. One of the tabs was broken when it arrived - and almost all of it snaps together with tabs. The floor is so flimsy that it has to be on a solid, flat surface. So glad I could return and so disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.author: Curly Color

customer_reviews.title: Liked it, but it's falling apart.
customer_reviews.text: The dog house is pretty easy to set-up...(it took two of us in my case, to set up both that I bought), and it's pretty spacious. I have 4 chiweenies and one maltipoo. Three of the cheewinies fit in one, and the other sleeps with the maltipoo in the second one. My only concern is that in just a couple days, the flaps started to fall off, and the screws didn't stay on at all very well. It wasn't too bad, because at the time, the weather was hot. Now that it's finally raining (because we don't get much rain in CA), it sucks because the water has been seeping into their elevated houses, and wetting their beds and blankets.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Quick lightweight shelter for medium sized dog
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to put together. Doggy loves it. It is lightweight and easy to move around. A strong wind will move it out of place. It came with clear flaps for the front opening however they only hook onto the upper inside edge and fall off easily when the dog goes in or out. You could put your own short screws or something to help it stay in place at the top inside edge. As I live in HI we will probably never need the flaps. Not sure how long it will last but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: We have been looking for months for a dog house that would fit our male 130lb Rottweiler. While most reviews said they were purchased for large dogs and they fit , we weren't so lucky. Our dog is too big for the dog house and let's be honest after the house is already put together , we're not going to take it apart and return it. Very disappointed with the purchase. My 18month old son has been playing in the house instead.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Marin

customer_reviews.title: Large and Sturdy Dog House
customer_reviews.text: Very good size and quality of dog house for the price. Definitely recommend. I have a black mouth cur dog and this house is plenty big enough for him. Larger dogs like a lab or german shepherd could fit easily in this house. directions to put it together were easy to follow. had it together in just a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: mt1968

customer_reviews.title: Good but over priced
customer_reviews.text: Not worth 80 bucks for plastic... but an ok dog house.... I would have been happier with paying maybe around 50 or so for it ... the plastic pieces are pretty flimsy when you get it .. but when it is finally put together.. it actually is ok. ... it is awkward to put together and there are no instructions..2 people can put it together fine ... and fast... overall ok dog house... it looks nice once put together
customer_reviews.author: vance

customer_reviews.title: great fit for my pitbull
customer_reviews.text: I have an 7month old pitbull that I got the house for. I have a smaller one for my blue heeler but they can't both fit in the smaller one. The dog house is easy to put together. I hot glue the floor and roof panels together because my dogs are kind of wild and the smaller one kept being taken apart. The hot glue works really well to keep it together and the general assembly is easy. My pitbull will definitely have a lot of room even after he is full grown.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they seemed to enjoy it. Had to make a smaller opening with ...
customer_reviews.text: bought for our neighborhood stray cats. was a bit of a hassle to assemble, but after the leaning curve was over, it came together smoothly. they seemed to enjoy it. Had to make a smaller opening with wood paneling - they wouldn't enter with the plastic flaps that were included.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Expected a lot more out of this, especially after reading reviews stating how great it is. Returned it as soon as it came in- it was so flimsy! I do not recommend, especially if you have a large-breed dog
customer_reviews.author: Miss Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Damaged in shipment
customer_reviews.text: I received the house today and took it out of the box. One of the corners of one of the sides was cracked. The pieces were just put into the box without any padding. As I do not have the luxury of returning the house, I glued the broken piece and hope that it holds. Also, one of the pegs that holds the plastic flaps was too large for the wing nut. So, managed to get it on but am not sure how well it will hold. I am disappointed in the quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Lilyann

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, great design, functional and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Dog house was super easy to set-up, the kids play in it and loved it, the DOG hates it unfortunately, but he thinks he's a human and is above these things. Other than that, it's a great size for a boxer-pit mix and even better for toddlers!! My only issue would be with the clips for the doggie door pieces, not too sturdy and didn't really function well, but you don't really need those things on there so it's not a big deal. At the moment it is sitting in pieces in our backyard because he decided to use it as a trampoline...maybe??
customer_reviews.author: johnd3101

customer_reviews.title: 75 lbs and below
customer_reviews.text: This house is great and I would have rated it 5 stars if it were a little bigger. It's super easy to put together (when you YouTube instructions) and the decals to put fido's name on it are wonderful. I just wish there had been room for my dog's full name: Kingston Disco Biscuit the 3rd. Really, it's not the company's fault that I gave my dog three names so we can't fault them. Seriously tho, it's high quality and the detachable roof is nice. My dog is 100 lbs and he fits but barely and doesn't really use it because of that. I would say it's for dogs 75 lbs and below despite what they rate it as.
customer_reviews.author: glitter girl

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery and good product
customer_reviews.text: I received the product 2 days before it was planned to be delivered. The product is great. Easy to assemble with 2 people. However, I wish I would have spent a little more money on a more sturdy dog house. BUT, I had read the other reviews and knew it would not be as study. It is not like it falls apart, but I have a 70 pound dog. Still a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Northrip

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: Has the potential to be great. Cheap plastic. Love the design but quality is low. Arrived with two pieces broken off and could barely get the thing together despite no tools being needed. Had I bought for a dog it would have been sent back immediately. But we're using it on the 'catio' for a couple of cats. As something to be used outside for dogs it's a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Rob mich

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this dog house. It was a bit tricky to assemble and it took two of us for one part. But overall it’s doing a great job of keeping my dog out of the rain when he’s outside. The only thing I’ve noticed is the rain flaps come off from time to time, so we need to check it. But other than that, for the money it’s a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Chsmom

customer_reviews.title: Can hold up to Michigan weather 3 years Plus
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 3 years ago still looks brand new we keep on our uncovered deck to shelter/shade the indoor outdoor cat when waiting for us to come home it is large enough for me to crawl into also to wipe clean but easily can hose down also my two under 15 pound dogs play in it just a great value and study as it’s outside 24/7 through all seasons in Michigan ( definitely could hold a large dog and not insulated )
customer_reviews.author: Char R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my two dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought the one for up to 90lbs because I have two that like to sleep together. Construction seems flimsy until you get all of the parts snapped together then it is sturdy. I did not buy the fleece liner because I pack the house bottom and sides with hay. I have a chow mix and a heeler mix, both are on the small side. They didn't care for the dog door, but I don't need it as there is wind break on three sides of the area where the house sits. Also noteworthy, my German Shepherd mix could fit in there by herself.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Super great packaging, easy to assemble, NO extra parts! I would DEF by a second time. Dogs did not like the flaps however... had to take them offf
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive dog house
customer_reviews.text: This shipment arrived on time and was very easy to put together. I had it ready for my Puppy in about 20 minutes. She seems to enjoy her new house and has plenty of room to grow. You can even add your dogs name with the stickers that are included. The house seems sturdy and looks nice. I think it will last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Greer

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Good price but it just didn't cut it. It's such crappy plastic it snaps and bends so easy. It blew across my yard and it ALL came apart breaking some of the legs to snap it in place. It's such crappy plastic, and it's a bummer because if it had more sturdy, lasting material it would be an awesome easy dog house. Definitely won't keep rain out, Definitely gonna snap out of place almost everyday. I wish I could recommend but its just too breakable.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Great durable product!
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the best things I have ever bought from Amazon! It was easy to put together and sturdy and spacious (I could sit up straight inside at 5'4) for my large Pitt Bull. For the price this is beyond excellent quality! I could not be more pleased with it! The Name stickers and paw prints are a cute addition as well. Note of advice: If you get size large or bigger, put it together outside since once together it does not fit though most doorways.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlets

customer_reviews.title: durable
customer_reviews.text: exactly what I need for my 100 lbs doberman. I do have a wooden pallet underneath just so it doesn't get wet when it rains. I am in Texas so i dont know if is good for a snow area because is not isolated. but great for the dog when the are outside the day. (i'm not sure for evening since my dogs sleep inside.
customer_reviews.author: PattyJ12

customer_reviews.title: Nice dog house for nice weather use
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad doghouse for the price. Snapped together easily enough (read the damn instructions and do it in order or you'll be cursing as you struggle to unsnap them all and start over...those snaps are sturdy!) This size was big enough for my 40lb terrier, my 3 year old neice and my 11 year old nephew...all together. Might have ordered a size smaller, but better too big than too small. My dog is indoors almost all of the time so spending a ton on a house didn't make sense. If your dog lives outside...spend the extra cash and get a better insulated house or he will bake in the summer and freeze in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: KMcM

customer_reviews.title: Decent Large Dog House
customer_reviews.text: Four stars because it is large and easy to put together. I'm not sure how well it will hold up over time as the plastic is pretty lightweight. It has a place in all four corners that allows you to stake it to the ground, which will probably be necessary since it is lightweight and somewhat top heavy. But it's a nice looking dog house, and it does come with letters to put your dogs name on the front. I say it's worth the price, you can't really beat $60 for a large dog house. But if you're looking for one that is heavy and really sturdy, this isn't the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: TaliaDenae

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Quite sturdy. However, I had to remove 1 of the door flaps; both are mounted from the inside and extend beyond the door opening and below the threshold. 1 of my mini Doxies got in but couldn't figure out how to get out.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline R Babcock

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $80
customer_reviews.text: Most dog stuff these days they make out of harder plastic. My dog chewed a piece off of this house the first day. The other brand plastic house I bought is harder plastic and I can see where they tried to chew but couldn't. I would not recommend this for puppies or larger breed dogs. The other one was $100, and it was definitely worth $20 more dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Turnis

customer_reviews.title: Great dog house
customer_reviews.text: Awesome house overall but it came woth a minor glitch from the actual manufacturer and not Amazon’s fault. I received 2 back panels and not a front panel with the door opening. So I had to cut out the door opening myself. Other than the only other negative was assembly of panels, which at forst appeared to be unstable. Once all panels were connected the house was rigid and ready for use. My large GS loves it and after his first night in it he slept like a baby!
customer_reviews.author: Rigo

customer_reviews.title: the dog house is easily built keeps pet warm and is ample room inside
customer_reviews.text: the dog house is easily built keeps pet warm and is ample room inside. Do recommend gluing the wing nuts that go on the two weather flaps and ensure dried before dog uses. one flap removed as dog was nervous yet it is still warmer inside... he smiles when he is in it... the roof comes off for inside cleaning. follow the directions to put on in reverse; mechanics become easier with confidence the more times done
customer_reviews.author: rosesthorns

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: Ok honestly it keeps my dog warm in the winter, you really have to pound all the panels to put it together, the roof doesn’t line up all the way, and the screws for the clear weather strips for the door don’t screw down all the way. The plus size is that I got it for my 80lb dog, but my 120 pound dog can easily fit in it too. It does what it’s suppose to, the only reason why I’m giving it a 4 star is because of the assembly mishaps.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Also the directions to build this house is very poor. I bought two
customer_reviews.text: The dog house is very light weight,. I have a 100lb Lab and I am sure if he turns around inside the dog house it will fall apart. I did glue all the joints, but it has thin walls all the way around. Also the directions to build this house is very poor. I bought two, and put one in the kennel building today. I hope it is in one piece tomorrow. Would never buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B, Los Molinos, CA

customer_reviews.title: Other reviews said it was sturdy but I found it to be very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: My dogs actually totally destroyed this house in about 2 days! It is very thin plastic. If you have a dog that likes to chew,definitely not the choice for you! Other reviews said it was sturdy but I found it to be very flimsy. The plastic is very thin and to me there is no really good means of holding it together. Once my dogs chewed a little on the roof, it all came crashing down!
customer_reviews.author: Laura  B

customer_reviews.title: Very well made!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this dog house for a year now and I have a 3 year old husky who is a rough and tumble kind of dog. This house is still in one piece and he loves it! Very well made and durable. I would recommend to anyone looking for a dog house.
customer_reviews.author: Imafyrstarter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect dog house
customer_reviews.text: The snap together feature to assemble needs some improvement. Very annoying to put together. But the house is perfect for my medium size dog, which is a 55 lb female German Shepherd. She has plenty of space. She is not a destructive dog so I've had no problems with it staying together. But I can see where it would be for dogs that are rough & tough. It probably wouldn't last with my make GSD. So if you have a laid back calm pup like mine this will work out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sthib

customer_reviews.title: Lovely way to spoil the dog!
customer_reviews.text: Looks wonderful and can be a protective house for the dog. It can be a small shed for equipment ,toys and outdoor stuff. So because it’s so nice looking .. you really are spoiling the dog. The house may not protect if you need thick walls. Walks looks fine for wet , rainy weather. In snowy cold areas you may need a thicker wall.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia S.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Doesn't fit together correctly, not even sort of study. The wind blew it over and it literally just fell apart. Returning asap
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Not easy
customer_reviews.text: First it didn’t come with letter and no instructions. Was not easy for me to assemble like the roof came apart when I had it put together and was taking out 🤦‍♀️ Like biggest pain in the ass! Hopefully my dog likes it and the roof doesn’t leak but he may not know it’s his bc I have no letters to put his name on it
customer_reviews.author: Cerena

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Easily assembled and sufficient for respite from rain and sun. Two small puppies easily fit in this dog house. In fact, the third puppy would fit, too, if he weren't such a jerk and would share. The stickers are a cute addition and it doesn't look tacky out in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easily customizable template
customer_reviews.text: The house is bare bones so to speak , but its easily customizable. The house comes in a basic template for people to make it their own , its all up to your imagination. If you don't know how to work with tools/paints/ and just plan to "click- it" together and then set it out in the rain/wind and expect it to hold up you're kidding yourself. Put Some screws in, paint it, insulate it, Carpet the floor, put a chimney in it, put rain gutters, glass windows, 4k TV, Surround Sound, Mini biscuit Bar, etc....
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Magnificent

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Not extremely sturdy. It did hold up in the rain and wind but I did have to snap a few pieces together. At the time of buying, I had a great Pyrenees puppy weighing roughly 50 pounds. Once he reached about 80 pounds he would have squeezed inside, but let's face it, he never used it! Great sizing for labs and maybe German shepherd size at max.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany E.

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy to put together everything just snaps together
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to put together everything just snaps together. It took me about 10 minutes to put it together by myself. It seems very sturdy. My only complaint is the flaps that it gives you for doors are worthless. The flaps are a thicker plastic but are supposed to be attached using wing nuts screwed on to stubs above the door opening. The stubs aren't threaded so there is nothing for the wing nut to grasp so the flaps fell off on day two and the wing nuts are lost somewhere in the straw that I put in the house. If the door flaps would stay on I'd give this a 5 but as it stands it's a 4.
customer_reviews.author: Adam R. House

customer_reviews.title: Suncast Outdoor Dog House with Door for our 70lb dog
customer_reviews.text: Took a minute to get here from the East coast to Cali, but So far so good. Easy to assemble, took 15 mins. Our 70 lb dog fits with no issues. He immediately made himself at home and slept in his new home the first night. I will order insulation before the winter time. Thanks again!
customer_reviews.author: Ruthless671

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it
customer_reviews.text: The screw pieces for the weather proof doors were broken. It doesn't have a raised floor that helps protect from elements as it says. The cracks let so much cold it my dog goes in bushes instead. Its also much smaller inside than the dimensions said. We bought something else completely
customer_reviews.author: Amy Foutch

customer_reviews.title: Very Roomy - Nice Doghouse
customer_reviews.text: This was really easy to put together and only took about 5 minutes. I did need a second set of hands though to help or it might have taken longer. It is very roomy and fits together tightly. Only downfall is it is flat on the ground as mentioned by other reviewers. I would recommend sitting it up on a pallet if you can. These look great and the name stickers are really cute. I'd definitely recommend this doghouse and will likely order another one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: chazmanian1974

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup. Dogs do not use it though
customer_reviews.text: My mom and I set this up and we had some initial confusion about the picture-instructions which weren’t very clear IMO, but once we got it the setup was very easy and took 2 minutes. 4 stars because it does what it’s meant to do and rain has not managed to get through the plastic snap-in-place design, but unfortunately after having it for about 6 months now neither of my two dogs have gone in it once...
customer_reviews.author: saraha

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be the right size for my dog (this was the biggest the brand had to offer) and once I noticed that it was way too small I didn't want to spend the time trying to return it. Pretty easy assembly but its very cheap/bendy plastic material. I thought it would at least be a hard plastic but nope. It currently is being used for my dogs toys out in the yard. One plus is at least it doesn't fade in color when out in the sun, easy to clean too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The dog house was very easy too put together
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 90lb giant schnauzer. The dog house was very easy too put together. Two days after buying the dog had ripped the roof off! My dog likes to climb on top and the thing fell apart! If you have a active, powerful dog, this is not the house to buy! I had to buy a bunch of self tapping screws to piece the dog house back together. Again it's a real cute product for a passive dog but any dog who is energetic and over 50lbs will destroy it in no time!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Roscoe

customer_reviews.title: but they all fit comfortably. Has remained dry during rainstorms and has help ...
customer_reviews.text: It took some time for our dogs to get used to this house because of the plastic flaps so we removed one, and took away their other houses, and all 5 of them fit in this house. Our dogs range in sizes/weights from about 7 lbs. to 15 lbs. so they're fairly smaller dogs, but they all fit comfortably. Has remained dry during rainstorms and has help up well in high winds. Directions are a little confusing but my teenage son and I were able to set it up in under 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Dolly B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs and small humans!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a puppy I saved off of the side of the road, who is now almost a year old. She's a German Shepherd / Beagle mix. We keep her on the porch when she needs sun since she ripped her run out of the ground recently. This is made out of decent quality and can fit a 5' human inside comfortably. Only downside is we built it inside but can't get it apart so now we have a new playhouse for the kids that come over and visit.
customer_reviews.author: Amethyst Rain

customer_reviews.title: light weight
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy as I hoped and very light weight. I think my lab will chew it up
customer_reviews.author: Susan C.

customer_reviews.title: TOO CUTE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the large for my Shiba Inu - he likes it so far - he's getting used to it but it's super cute! Easy to assemble - seems weather proof so far - my dog's not crazy about the plastic door so I took it off and the material isn't that heavy but it doesn't need to be? Either way - happy we bought it for the little guy for those hot sunny summer days around the corner!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok for summer or warm climates
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have always had wooden houses .. I didn’t want the expense of another heavy duty house. This is hard plastic.. it’s ok for summer or warmer weather climates . No insulation. Not a winter weather house. For that you need a heavy duty wooden house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it is still just perfect. It was very easy to snap together and ...
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid after reading other reviews that this buying house would be a mistake! However, while it is thin plastic and not quite the "Tonka toy" plastic it appears to be, it is still just perfect. It was very easy to snap together and it only took about 15 minutes from start to finish. We are in Florida, so the dog house doesn't need insulation but if it gets very cold where you live I'd look at adding insulation. It is the perfect size for our 60 lb dog and we are very happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: Momof4

customer_reviews.title: GREAT house !!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could buy over, I'd buy the larger one. My dog is a Australian Cattle dog and he has to buckle in the back to go in and out. It's hard on his hips. Nice house but if you have a medium to large dog just go with a bigger one and it will save your dog from having to adjust to get in or out.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Good Price, Ehh Quality
customer_reviews.text: Our German Shepherd had this deconstructed in 2 hours. It seems very flimsy but we thought there were enough good reviews we would try it. If you have a dog that doesn't like to play with anything in sight then this might be the house for you. As far as size goes it was big enough for our GSD or our Golden Retriever to get in comfortably. The "doors" are two pieces of heavy plastic - I don't think you could use them in the summer but would be good for winter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY SATISFIED
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put together pretty decent size for the price, I have a 10 month old pit bull she’s about 50 lbs and it’s great for her my buddy is 5’9 230 lbs and he got inside so there’s that but not bad at all would definitely recommend and it came early which doesn’t love that !?
customer_reviews.author: Kameryn C.

customer_reviews.title: Plastic dog house? Sure. Why not?
customer_reviews.text: How to you review a plastic dog house when this is the first one you ever owned? Personal experience, I guess. I have a medium sized blue nose pit bull and although he didn’t know why this thing was now in his space, he’s grown accustomed to sleeping comfortably in it. It came together fast and easily and I love how easy it is to move around. So far, it has withstood sun, rain and wind. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Chizzle

customer_reviews.title: Great for our pup!
customer_reviews.text: Hubby put it together in a minute and was impressed at the quality and construction--very sturdy and looks like it will last a long time. A pleasant surprise was the plastic sheeting that acts as "doors" to keep the rain out--totally missed that detail in the description. Only concern is the lack of ventilation--only opening is the door, but I'm sure my husband will MacGyver something to solve that issue.
customer_reviews.author: lianekaye

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog House
customer_reviews.text: Great dog house.... my new adopted girl loves it. Shipping was amazingly quick, arrived at my door on a Saturday morning. The house went together very quickly and with little effort for one person, but two people would make the roof connection easier. One comment someone made was they though it was flimsy and coming out of the package I see what they mean but when you have it all assembled its very sturdy. I fastened it to a raised plywood base for insulation and to make access easier for my dog to get in and out. Great product and great price. Thanks, Rich
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gerardi

customer_reviews.title: Durable, personalization for furry babies and its waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: Our 13-year-old lab loves his new home. Assembly was witnessed to be not too difficult and the personalization feature of sticker application of furry friend's name onto house was a delightful feature. Dogs now compete as to whom is going to occupy the warm/cool doghouse (depending on the season). May have to buy another one---accommodates two 30-50 lb. dogs with good temperament.
customer_reviews.author: India Marie Clamp

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and very large
customer_reviews.text: This dog house is very large. It's kind of too big for my 65lb pit. The entire thing is made of plastic with no insulation. It was relatively easy to put together and looks just as good as it does in the picture. The flaps at the opening are very cheap and fell apart very easily. One of the flaps I was never able to get connected correct as the hardware provided would not stay in place. I ended up just removing the flaps as they looked ugly all torn up. Good house if you are not looking for something insulated and do not care about the opening flaps.
customer_reviews.author: Colee

customer_reviews.title: It is a good sturdy dog house
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a dog house that was not extremely expensive and I was fortunate enough to come across this one. Assembling the doghouse was not a hassle. There is also plastic doors that hang in front of the house. It is also very unique that you can add the letters of your dog's name on it. It is made out of plastic but it's pretty tough, my 10 month old husky has been trying to bite it any chance given. I would recommend for anyone who has a heavy chewer dog.
customer_reviews.author: TheAmazonQueen

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Super big and super easy to set up. For the price you can't beat it. We been having big rains and winds and it has held up very well. I have my two dogs in there. Both puppies. One's a weiner dog and one is a Chihuahua and Cockerspaniel mix. Love the doors btw. Not insulated for anything but plenty of blankets and a tarp around the inside helps. They stay very dry and between three adults and two toddlers it took about 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for Less Energetic Dogs?
customer_reviews.text: Good size and easy to put together. Came quickly and appeared as advertised. However, our athletic 35 lb beagle likes to jump on its roof, which then separates and has to be reattached by DH. Doors/edges not "dog proofed" against chewers. A simple metal strip around door would prevent chewing on the plastic, I think. It is also very light-weight. We live in middle TN, but our moderate winds during rain, as well as the dog herself, easily move the house around the kennel. I think this company gave a good effort, but should consider building only for very small docile dogs. Will go back to a wood dog house when this needs to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan C. White

customer_reviews.title: Got a set, my dogs loved them!
customer_reviews.text: Have a shepherd and a sheprador, both kinda big, and they had no problem getting in and out of the houses, i didnt use any of the door flaps so i wont be able to write about how they hold up. Great value for the money, pretty sturdy once they are snapped together.
customer_reviews.author: necromstr69

customer_reviews.title: Floor are bad
customer_reviews.text: receive the item in 3 days, put together are not hard, but the only week of use and I was found the floor start not even, reinstall again and it can't take care the issue, my dog was only 60 lbs, it looks the floor piece was too weak to support the dog weight.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great dog house for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Had a little issue with assembly, but it was user error. Really nice life the money. Live in Las Vegas so we’ll see how it holds in the summer. Comes with lettering to add the name to the front, which is a fun little bonus. Have a golden retriever and he loves it
customer_reviews.author: K3lli3

customer_reviews.title: Blows apart in rain storms
customer_reviews.text: Lasted maybe 2 months and I had to reassemble twice. We get rainstorms in Colorado and this is not an adequate dog house. Its such a pain to reassemble all the time and it eventually didn't want to go back together. Junk in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: I. Berryman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. I got the large one for my 90 Lb. pit but it was way too small. The large one is probably big enough for a 30 to 40 pound dog.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: My dog does NOT like the dog house
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a year now. My dog does NOT like the dog house, but she will go in it when it is storming really bad. She would rather dig a hole in the yard. The dog house was very easy to put together and it has stayed together very well out in the elements of the past year. We did have a hurricane scare and several really bad storms. As long as it has been up against the house and unable to be blown away it has been fine. Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mary-Royce Lookabill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this house for my American Bulldog. She is a 135 lb and she definitely outgrew her old house. We were having a hard time finding a house that she didn't squeeze in and out of. We decided to give this house a try and we were definitely not disappointed. When it arrived, we spent a few minutes snapping the pieces together. Once it was set up, Princess came up and gave this house a try. She fit perfectly! She can turn around and sit up inside.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica Verduzco

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight and not so sturdy material
customer_reviews.text: For the price of this product, I thought it would be a little more sturdy. The weather flaps unscrew very easily and when my dog lays on the bottom, even though it’s on the ground, it caves in a little when my dog lays on it. I suggest putting something more stable under the dog house like long flat crates. You may need better screws to hold on the weather flaps. Also if your dog is a chewer this won’t be good for them, it’s very easy to chew through.
customer_reviews.author: Auriana

customer_reviews.title: Not just for dogs :-)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for outdoor cats that come into my yard. I keep food, water and bedding in it. The cats love it. I have it on a platform so no snow gets in and it’s off the cold ground. I keep hand warmers inside for a bit of warmth. While it’s plastic & can’t provide warmth it does provide shelter & helps keep them shaded & cool in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl nickel

customer_reviews.title: ... this dog house about a week ago and I love it! I have a Plott Hound who weighs ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dog house about a week ago and I love it! I have a Plott Hound who weighs 83 pounds and he fits in his house perfectly. He even has room to circle around before lying down. I love that there are two plastic flaps that block the weather. It is very sturdy and extremely easy to put together.Make sure all of the snaps are snapped in. (Also- make sure you put it together outside, or like me, you will have to figure out how to get it in the back yard because the dog house is wider than the average door way LOL). Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: snapped together fine. floor in center does not want to stay ...
customer_reviews.text: walls and front and back , snapped together fine. floor in center does not want to stay together very well. roof wants to separate at each end a little, but will work. it is a decent dog box. clear, flexible doors went on easily and is a nice addition. they will come off easy for summer weather.
customer_reviews.author: TERENCE A COURSEN

customer_reviews.title: Never judge a book.......
customer_reviews.text: When I received this product, I was very sceptical about not buying the more expensive product because the pieces felt very flimsy, at first I almost didn't put it together. Once I did, it was a fantastic surprise. The pieces went together very easily, and once together, it is pretty sturdy. It didn't take long to put together, and my 75 lb. dog fits in without a problem. A great feature is you can stake it down from the inside, and with a nice pad or dog bed, nothing to hurt your dogs paws are exposed. Very happy with it, simple, easy to follow instructions, and it looks good. Great product and would recommend it to my friends
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Embree

customer_reviews.title: My Dog loves - Suncast you need to do better quality checking for a product made in the USA.
customer_reviews.text: Very Easy to assemble. One flaw in the manufacturing - a post a wingnut screws onto for attaching a vinyl flap was molded slightly smaller, hence the wingnut keep falling - a little plumbers tape took care of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Book addict

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: Overall a nice dog house, but mine didn't come with the promised vinyl door.. Assembly was pretty easy, but if you want to take it apart to move it except some plastic attachments to break. :/
customer_reviews.author: Olivia B.

customer_reviews.title: People and Dog Love the New House
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly strong for a plastic doghouse! My husky demolished the wooden doghouse the former owners built for her, but she seems to like this one just fine. With our mild winters down South, she doesn't often need to be inside, but we get enough rain to keep her dry and cozy. For the price, which was excellent, we got a real bargain. We purchased the K&H Crate Pad to go inside (got large; should have gotten XL) and she like that as well. Everyone, including the dog, is happy with it. Did I mention it looks good too? Highly recommended to any dog owner.
customer_reviews.author: WynterFire11

customer_reviews.title: Great house!
customer_reviews.text: This dog house is a very good product! The assembly was easy, but it did take a good pound of a hammer to really get the pieces stuck together. Unfortunately my dogs only saw a giant chew toy and the house didn't make it a week. If your dog can't resist temptation to bit at the part of the roof that hangs off of the house, this house would be a no go. Other than that, the house was quiet roomy and easily fit my two 70 lb. Dogs inside.
customer_reviews.author: Anc

customer_reviews.title: Nice design
customer_reviews.text: Great dog house. Lol Except my dog won’t use it. He is to busy patrolling his back yard for illegal aliens
customer_reviews.author: brian mcneese

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the Price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a decent doghouse. The plastic makes it weather resistant and the door flaps keep the elements out. Assembly is fairly easy, but keep in mind that assembly should be done in the general area where it is to be used. The clip and lock system makes assembly quick but potentially open to breakage with excessive movement. I added insulation to the interior of the panels and set it up on cinder block to keep it warm and dry. It was actually larger than I had anticipated and both my dogs can fit inside together.
customer_reviews.author: Kerrie A.

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not Cute
customer_reviews.text: Pretty flimsy dog house. It took two people to put it together. Although its pretty cute its not holding up quite well as i expected. I have dogs that are 80 lbs and these houses are pretty much coming apart. possibly if dogs were smaller it would work also maybe for indoors and not outside use with the wind and rain that we have here.
customer_reviews.author: Lina Bo

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our large yellow lab for the winter. Although he's not a big fan of it and prefers to bunk up with our neighbor's dog in their dog house our little house dog really loves it when she's outside! It's plenty big for the lab- he's just a weirdo. The dog house is sturdy and was easy to snap together. I'm very impressed at the quality for the price! Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: A to Z for Moms Like Me

customer_reviews.title: Cute house, but not so sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: The house is adorable and simple to put together. I bought this for our chickens. If I had bought this for our dogs, it wouldn't have lasted three days. It is flimsy and not held together very well. I will probably put a few fasteners through the joints just to be sure it stays together. I am not so confident this will hold up against winds. Overall, the house is really cute.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough for my German Shepard
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this product only to be disappointed. I was not expecting a super sturdy product but I was expecting better quality than it was. It was very flimsy and difficult for one person to assemble.plus I got it together and then noticed the roof was damaged. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tish

product_meta.title: Suncast Outdoor Dog House with Door - Water Resistant and Attractive for Small to Large Sized Dogs - Easy to Assemble - Perfect for Backyards
product_meta.description: The Suncast Outdoor Dog House is an attractive backyard solution for your pets, both small and large (measures 35" x 27" x 29.5"). The modern design is fashioned to complement the furniture and decor of your patio or backyard. Built with hardened plastic that resists fading, rust and rot, the kennel's attractive appearance will last in even the toughest outdoor conditions. The durable resin is strong and sturdy, and the components snap together with ease without the need for tools making assembly a breeze. Also includes a vinyl door for additional protection from the weather and other animals.
feature_bullets: OUTDOOR DOG HOUSE: Attractive dog house for pets up to 70 pounds is perfect for your backyard, patio and deck
DURABLE: Constructed from heavy-duty resin with a crowned floor to keep your pet safe from all weather elements
CONVENIENT: Dog house snaps together with ease, so your pet can enjoy their new home right away
BUILT TO LAST: The contemporary house design matches most outdoor décor, and it resists fading and washes easily for years of quality use
DOOR INCLUDED: Vinyl door (measures 11.75" x 20.5") provides additional security and insulation for your pet without obstructing entry or exit

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
